metadata.title: CVE-2018-6120 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow that could lead to an attacker-controlled heapout-of-bounds write in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 66.0.3359.170allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via acrafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0.3359.181-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
